name.baseName: Municipal sludge treatment and disposal;dry sludge;brick manufacturing
市政污泥处理与处置;干污泥;制砖

dataSetInformation.common:generalComment: The main data sources used in our study are as follows: 1) Energy consumption and material inputs are obtained from investigations in Tai Lake Watershed; 2) The energy use emission factor is obtained from our own calculation, IPCC, and the literature.3) The fugitive emissions during landfilling, incineration, and composting are mainly determined by the model given in the other study as well as by the IPCC factors (2006), except for the CH4 emission in landfilling, which is obtained from study.4) Data from theoretical calculations (see Incineration section).
本文研究的主要数据来源如下:1)能源消耗和物质投入来源于对太湖流域的调查;2)能源利用排放因子来源于我们自己的计算、IPCC和文献。3)填埋过程中的CH4排放由文献获得，填埋、焚烧和堆肥过程中的无组织排放主要由文献研究中给出的模型和IPCC因子(2006)决定。4)理论计算数据(焚烧部分)。

quantitativeReference.functionalUnitOrOther: The functional unit used for GHGs in this LCA is one dry ton (DT) of sludge.

technology.technologyDescriptionAndIncludedProcesse: At a substitution rate of 10% (10 tons of brick/cement will be produced by 1 DT of sludge and other raw materials), only 0.3 tons of ash from 1 DT of sludge is integrated into the products, thus substituting the same amount of raw materials.
在替代率为10%的情况下(1 DT污泥和其他原料生产10吨砖/水泥)，1 DT污泥中只有0.3吨灰分被纳入产品，从而替代了相同数量的原料。
technology.technologicalApplicability: This LCA data set describes the use of dry sludge from municipal sludge treatment and disposal as an additive material in brick manufacturing. Specifically, the dry sludge is sourced from procedures conducted within the Tai Lake Watershed area. It is utilized to produce bricks, possibly serving as a partial substitute for traditional raw materials such as clay, helping to improve sustainability in brick production.
本 LCA 数据集描述了来自太湖流域市政污泥处理和处置的干污泥作为砖制造的添加材料。具体而言，干污泥用以生产砖块，可能作为传统原料例如黏土的部分替代品，帮助提升砖制造的可持续性。

referenceToDataSource.common:shortDescription: Liu, B., Wei, Q., Zhang, B. & Bi, J. Life cycle GHG emissions of sewage sludge treatment and disposal options in Tai Lake Watershed, China. Science of The Total Environment 447, 361–369 (2013).
Liu, B., Wei, Q., Zhang, B. & Bi, J. Life cycle GHG emissions of sewage sludge treatment and disposal options in Tai Lake Watershed, China. Science of The Total Environment 447, 361–369 (2013).

dataSourcesTreatmentAndRepresentativenes.useAdviceForDataSet: When utilizing this data set for LCA, it is important to consider the specific properties and context of the dry sludge as used within the Tai Lake Watershed area's brick manufacturing process. Users should account for any variations in GHG emissions based on the local practices and technologies employed. Attention should be given to system boundaries, ensuring that the use phase and end-of-life phase of the bricks, including potential recycling, are consistently modeled according to LCA standards.
在使用此数据集进行生命周期评估时，必须考虑太湖流域砖制造过程中使用的干污泥的特定属性及其应用背景。用户应根据当地实施的实践和技术考虑温室气体排放的任何变化。应关注系统边界，确保砖的使用阶段和生命周期终端阶段，包括潜在的回收利用，都依据生命周期评估标准进行一致性建模。

review.common:reviewDetails: Inventory: The internal review was done by several iteration steps concerning raw data validation, raw data documentation, representativity, completeness and consistency of modelling with regard to ISO 14040 and 14044.
清单： 内部审查通过几个迭代步骤完成，涉及原始数据验证、原始数据记录、代表性、完整性、与 ISO 14040 和 14044 有关的建模的一致性。

publicationAndOwnership.common:licenseType: Free of charge for all users and uses
